snippet: As patients assume more of the responsibility for costs, complex billing and more aggressive collection by providers are resulting in negative credit report data that lingers for years.
abstract: Medical bill paying is becoming more complex as patients take on a greater share of costs, causing many patients to fall victim to aggressive collection by providers when they make errors; even small mistakes related to multiple bills, deductibles or coinsurance can result in negative credit report data that lingers for years.
lead_paragraph: As patients assume more of the responsibility for costs, complex billing and more aggressive collection by providers are resulting in negative credit report data that lingers for years.

headline.seo: Medical Debts Can Leave Stains on Credit Scores
headline.main: Discrepancies on Medical Bills Can Leave a Credit Stain

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
